g.text: Fermi levels stem essentially from contributions of the M-d
and S-p atomic orbitals. The heteroatomic M
change from bonding to antibonding states below the Fermi
levels in all sulﬁdes and, hence, are of an antibonding nature at
the Fermi levels. The antibonding M
homoatomic interactions arise mainly from the M-d bands
located around the Fermi levels. An integration of the

position may vary from system to system.
